item.title: Mailing lists
item.content:
wxPerl-users
This list is for wxPerl users, you can visit the archives, or (un)subscribe.

item.title: Project page
item.content: wxPerl is graciusly hosted by SourceForge, from the project page you can access the bug tracker, download previous releases, submit feature requests, etc.

content.p: wxDesigner is a commercial tool for designing user interfaces for wxPerl (and wxWidgets and wxPython, too). A trial version is available for download.

wxGlade is a GUI designer written in Python with the popular GUI toolkit wxPython, that helps you create wxWidgets/wxPython/wxPerl user interfaces. At the moment it can generate Python, Perl, C++ and XRC (wxWidgets' XML resources) code.

module.name: Wx::Perl::TreeChecker
module.description: a Wx::TreeCtrl whose items can be checked using checkboxes.

module.name: Wx::Perl::FSHandler::LWP
module.description: a Wx::FileSystemHandler subclass, replacement for Wx::InternetFShandler. It allows retrieving documents for Wx::HtmlWindow (and other classes using Wx::FileSystem) via LWP::UserAgent.

module.name: Wx::GLCanvas
module.description: a wrapper for wxWidgets' wxGLCanvas, used to display OpenGL graphics. To use it you will need the OpenGL module. OpenGL for ActivePerl 8xx.

module.name: Wx::ActiveX
module.description: a wrapper for wxActiveX. It allows using ActiveX controls such as Internet Explorer and Flash from wxWidgets/wxPerl programs. It only works under Windows. The current version provides specialised interfaces for Acrobat Reader, Internet Explorer, Flash and Windows Media Player.
